intro: Haplophyllum obovatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed rockrose, is a perennial shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early summer. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that are obovate in shape, adapted to retain water in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive and resilient addition to xeriscaped landscapes.
